#Text=CanadaVOTES : NDP candidate Hana Razga running in Edmonton — Leduc
#Text=Tuesday , September 23 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=New Democratic Party candidate Hana Razga is standing for election in the riding of Edmonton — Leduc .
#Text=Born in London , England to Czechoslovakian parents , she immigrated to Canada in 1968 , having a long career in human resources with the federal government .
#Text=She is a volunteer for organizations including the Alberta Women 's Shelter , Big Sisters and Match International .
#Text=She has previously run in campaigns three times provincially for the NDP , and once federally .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Hana Razga , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=Created in 2004 , the riding consists of southwest Edmonton , the City of Leduc , the Town of Devon , and the surrounding area .
#Text=Contesting Conservative incumbent James Rajotte are Razga , Valerie Kennedy ( Green ) , and Donna Lynn Smith ( Liberal ) .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?

#Text=I decided to get involved ( again ) because I have the time and enough energy to do it ; because I believe it is imperative to have more women around the decision making table and because I hope to make a difference .
#Text=The NDP is closest to my views and beliefs regarding the environment , social justice and gender equality
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/lifeexperience to serving your constituents ?

#Text=I ran provincially for NDP in 1997 ( Edmonton Manning ) , 2001 ( Edmonton Manning ) , 2008 ( Edmonton Whitemud ) , federally in 1997 ( Edmonton East ) , as well as in municipal elections in 2007 .

#Text=My lengthy career as a Human Resources Consultant for the federal government has provided her with skills in communicating , mediating , team building , negotiating , collaboration , all skills that will serve me well in my political career .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The issue of leadership - When the Harper ’s conservatives got elected and formed the government in 2006 , they were supposed to be a different , more open and accountable government .

#Text=Instead , they are and continue to cover up mistakes , avoid speaking truth and answer legitimate questions from the members of the opposition , constantly lay blame on members of the opposition or previous liberal regime , show little respect for diverse opinions or beliefs , mistreat others and abuse power .
#Text=They demotivate and offend others through cynicism and aggression .
#Text=Instead being more open and accountable , Mr. Harper ’s government is the most secretive and divisive that I ever remember .
#Text=And people that I talk to on the doorstep are voicing their disappointment with this government .

#Text=The are also disappointed in the government ’s handling of the environmental file , war in Afghanistan , Omar Khadr file and all the other gaffes , either during their reign ( Maxime Bernier , “ in and out ” scandal , Chuck Cadman controversy ) or during the campaign ( attack ads aired even before the campaign started , pooping puffin , Jerry Ritz etc ) , well you get the picture…. .
#Text=Jack Layton and his team ( of which I hope to be a part ) , have been the real opposition to Stephen Harper .
#Text=And we believe it is time that we have a Prime Minister that puts the needs of the ordinary Canadians families first .

#Text=We will fight to protect jobs ; reduce the growing income gap between the best-off and the rest of us ; and unlike Stephen Harper , we will protect Canadian families from rip-offs and food scandals .
#Text=We will make sure health care is there when you need it , reducing wait times by hiring more doctors and nurses
#Text=And we will cut pollution with tough new laws and firm targets .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=Not so much about Jack Layton or myself , however people feel that we are the tax and spend party .
#Text=This is actually not borne out .

#Text=Most of our platform commitments ( in any of the elections I ran ) were all costed out , and most of the money for our initiatives would be coming from shifting the enormous tax cuts for profitable corporations that do not need it ( given by the previous governments both liberal and conservative ) , to areas where the benefits would be to much larger Canadian population .
#Text=There are more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=Direct voter contact through door knocking
#Text=Combination of all of the above noted ways
